headline: IMDb Launches New B2B Data Licensing Solutions at the IBC Show 2025, Empowering Companies to Grow their Business with Entertainment Data and Insights
summary: SEATTLE, September 03, 2025--IMDb (www.imdb.com), the world's most popular and authoritative source for information on movies, TV shows, and celebrities, will launch new entertainment datasets for companies to license at the IBC Show, September 12-15 in Amsterdam. Companies can learn more about licensing authoritative movie and TV data and exclusive insights from IMDb at developer.imdb.com.

headline: EU Court Dismisses Zalando’s Challenge to Online Content Law
summary: The European Union’s general court upheld a decision by tech regulators to impose tougher rules on German online retailer  Zalando  under the bloc’s digital content law.  The court said Wednesday that it backed the decision by the European Commission, the bloc’s executive arm, to label the company—which sells clothing from brands like Mango and Bershka alongside Gucci sunglasses—as a “very large online platform” under the Digital Services Act.  The EU’s rulebook requires companies classed as such to make more effort to counter illegal and harmful content online as well as illegal or dangerous products sold on their websites.

raw.headline: EU Court Dismisses Zalando’s Challenge to Online Content Law
raw.summary: The European Union’s general court upheld a decision by tech regulators to impose tougher rules on German online retailer  Zalando  under the bloc’s digital content law.  The court said Wednesday that it backed the decision by the European Commission, the bloc’s executive arm, to label the company—which sells clothing from brands like Mango and Bershka alongside Gucci sunglasses—as a “very large online platform” under the Digital Services Act.  The EU’s rulebook requires companies classed as such to make more effort to counter illegal and harmful content online as well as illegal or dangerous products sold on their websites.
